meanings.definition: A person who stands, especially in a public place.
meanings.sent1: The standee waited patiently at the bus stop.
meanings.sent2: The standee in the park enjoyed the sunshine.
meanings.sent3: The standee at the concert started dancing while waiting.
meanings.sent4: She was a standee in the sea of people, trying to catch a glimpse of the parade.
meanings.sent5: The standee's shadow stretched long in the evening sun.

meanings.definition: A promotional display that stands upright.
meanings.sent1: The store had a colorful standee advertising the new product.
meanings.sent2: The standee of the movie poster caught the attention of passersby.
meanings.sent3: The standee of the cartoon character seemed to wave at the customers.
meanings.sent4: The standee of the superhero stood tall, towering over the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The standee's bright colors made it stand out among the other ads.

meanings.definition: A ticket for standing room only at an event.
meanings.sent1: She purchased a standee for the sold-out concert.
meanings.sent2: The standee allowed him access to the crowded event.
meanings.sent3: The standee ticket meant she had to stand throughout the show.
meanings.sent4: Having a standee meant he could still enjoy the performance.
meanings.sent5: The standee ticket saved her from missing the event.
